column3: The sky is clear, the morning’s here
Do you have to do that
I hate the color of these walls
I hate the fact that this place still smells like bird
I hate the fact that my room is so small
Hey, I have all the space I need
Monica, you don’t even have a bed, you sleep in a ball on the floor
I am really tired of your bellyaching
Okay, I-I worked really hard at making this a nice place for us to live
See, this is a great apartment
Oh, blimey, I still can’t believe you’ve got an earring
I think it makes you look really dangerous
Y’know what, I never would’ve gotten this if it weren’t for you
No really, when I’m with you I’m-I’m like this whole other guy, I love that guy
I mean, I love you too, a lot, but that guy
I wish I didn’t have to go
Just don’t go so soon to London, just one more day
Don’t do this to me, again
You’d know I’d stay here in a minute, but I’d really miss so much work, they’ll fire me
So, then you can stay as long as you want
I don’t think you understand packing
Look, I just don’t want to leave it to the last minute
Last time I left in such a rush, I left my knickers here
Yeah, I know, I uh, I tried them on
I didn’t want to be that guy
I just, I went to a used clothes store and got a bunch of maternity stuff
Uhh, Pheebs, those are uh, those are Santa pants
They even came with a list of baby names
See, these names are good, and these names are bad
How are the-the-the-the, y’know—You’re clothes aren’t funny
Hey, guys, what-what should I wear to a Knicks game
Uhh, a T-shirt that says, "I don’t belong here
Yeah, my mom got my dad’s season tickets in the divorce, so she just gave them to me
Yeah, apparently, they’re pretty good seats
Those are almost right on the floor
Just give us our apartment back
We know what these are worth
Yeah, what, do you think we’re stupid
Okay, I’m not giving up my bachelor pad for some basketball seats
Have you even had a girl up here
But uh, Joey has, and I usually talk to them in the morning time
Yes, Gunther, can I get two cups of chino, please
Season tickets, do you know what that means
Okay, I’m not giving up the apartment
Oh come—look, when I was a kid my dad’s company gave season tickets to the number one salesman every year, all right
Of course, he wasn’t in the sales division, but still, I never ever, ever forgot that
We don’t make enough fun of you already
Oh yeah, Emily convinced me to do it
You do know that Wham broke up
I like it, and Emily likes it, and that’s what counts
So uh, how are you guys doing
Oh-no, don’t try and talk all normal with that thing in your ear
Ugh, she’s saying good-bye to her uncle
Man, didn’t she like just get here
I just, I hate this so much
I mean, every time I go pick her up at the airport, it’s-it’s so great
But at the same time I’m thinking, "Well, I’m gonna be right back there in a couple of days, dropping her off
So what are you going to do
I mean, she lives there, I live here
I mean, she-she’d have to uh, move here
I could ask her to live with me
I mean, I mean why not
Because you’ve only known her for six weeks
Okay, I’ve got a carton of milk in my fridge I’ve had a longer relationship with
Look guys, when I’m with her it’s-it’s-it’s like she brings this-this-this great side out of me
I mean I-I-I love her, y’know
But, I’m not gonna some British girl to move in with me
All right look, Ross, he’s right
But this way too soon, you’re only gonna scare her
I don’t want to do that
You don’t want to wreck it, you don’t want to go to fast
Yeah, no, you’re right, I know, you’re right, I’m not, I’m not gonna do it
Okay, no problem, just remember to wake us up before you go-go
All right boys, last chance for the tickets
Or I’ll give them to my new boyfriend, Joshua
The timing’s perfect, I just clogged the toilet
Look, I want those basketball seats as much as you do
Okay, but we can’t leave in the small apartment after we’ve lived here
Didn’t you ever read Flowers for Algernon
Didn’t you ever read Sports Illustrated
But come on, we can go to the game tonight
Look, the only way I will even consider this is if they offer a lot more than just season seats
I just meant that the apartment is worth so much more
We’re not gonna do that, y’know why
Because its not an even trade
All right, okay, look, what if you could keep the apartment and get the tickets
I’m talking about a bet, winner takes all
Ooh, we could end up with nothing
Or you could end up with everything
All right, so what do you say
Come on man, you know I’d do it for you
All right, but you can’t use that again for a whole year
Ooh, God, what are you going to bet
Oh, okay, well, I think we should let Phoebe decide, because she’s the only who’s impartial, and she’s so pretty
Umm, ooh, ooh—oh, I have a game
Oh, well, it doesn’t have a name—oh, okay, Phoebeball
No, it doesn’t have a name
Umm, okay, Monica, what is your favourite thing about trees
Both fine answers, but we were looking for leafy, leafy
You wanna finish this right now
All right, we get a deck of cards, high card wins
Oh no, these are the trick deck
Okay, you guys uh, you guys pick first
What make you think I can
Why are you screaming and hugging
Because we won our apartment back
All right, cut, let’s pick again, pick again
Uh-huh, not as high as… It worked
What are they so mad about
I packed while you were gone
I left some knickers under your pillow
Don’t be scared, I-I know it sounds crazy and-and people will say it’s too soon, but just-just think, think how great it will be
Oh, leaving London, my whole family lives there
Well, so, you-you’ll get a job here
I mean, I’m always hearing about uh, them foreigners coming in here and stealing American jobs; that could be you
Yeah, but it-it-it’s my whole life—you come to England
I would, I really would, but my son is here; I can’t leave him
Isn’t—you don’t think there’s any way
I mean it would be different if it was way into the future –and-and-and we were getting married or something
Oh no, no, right I shouldn’t have said married
Uh, please don’t go freaky on me
Well, I didn’t say it; I take it back
I mean it’s better than you just-just moving here, ‘cause it’s us together forever, and that’s-that’s what I want
We’ve only known each other for six weeks
Does that me we-we can’t do it
Look, huh, I was with Carol for four years before we got married and I wound up divorced from a pregnant lesbian
I mean, this, this makes sense for us
I mean, on our first date we ended up spending the whole weekend in Vermont
I mean, last night I got my ear pierced
My parents are going to be really mad
I thought that was going to be romantic as hell
Those were like the best seats ever
Should we give these shirts to the girls
Y’know, kinda like a peace offering
Plus, y’know they were free and they’re too small
We’ll discuss it, in the morning
What the hell is going on
I had nothing to do with it
Okay, it was my idea, but I don’t feel good about it
We are switching back, right now
Well, you’re gonna have to leave sometime, because you both have jobs, and as soon as you do, we’re switching it back
There’s nothing you can do to stop us
I don’t want to move again
I don’t care, this is our apartment
And they stole—you stole it—our apartment, and we won that apartment fair and square, twice
And I am getting it back right now
We figured you might respond this way, so we have a backup offer
You can’t offer anything to us
Let us keep the apartment and…
As a thank you, Rachel and I will kiss for one minute
Can you believe that something that stupid actually got us our apartment back
That’s so funny to think if you’d just done that right after the last contest, no one would have had to move at all
Yeah, let-let-let’s pretend that’s not true
Ross has some big thing to tell everyone
Uhh, okay, it’s uh, Emily and I, we decided to uh, to get married
When, when did—how, how did you…
We, we just decided to uh, to go for it
I mean, we know it’s a bit hasty but, uh, it just feels so right, so…
Umm, uh, I was just telling the guys…
Ohh, I’m so happy for you
I can’t believe you’re getting married
